name: MyGene.info
description: The MyGene.info API provides access to a wide collection of aggregated gene resources.

services.name: MyGene.info gene query service
services.description: Make gene query and return matching gene list.

inputParameter.name: q
inputParameter.description: The query string consisting of HGNC gene names, RefSeq identifiers, or Affymetrix probe identifiers

inputParameter.name: fields
inputParameter.description: a comma-separated fields to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any gene object (e.g. http://mygene.info/v2/gene/1017). Note that it supports dot notation as well, e.g., you can pass "refseq.rna". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned.

inputParameter.name: callback
inputParameter.description: pass a callback parameter to make a JSONP call.

inputParameter.name: species
inputParameter.description: Can be used to limit the gene hits from given species. You can use common names for nine common species (human, mouse, rat, fruitfly, nematode, zebrafish, thale-cress, frog and pig). All other species, you can provide their taxonomy ids. Multiple species can be passed using comma as a separator. Passing "all" will query against all available species.

inputParameter.name: size
inputParameter.description: The maximum number of matching gene hits to return (with a cap of 1000 at the moment)

inputParameter.name: from
inputParameter.description: The number of matching gene hits to skip, starting from 0. Combining with size parameter can be useful for paging.

inputParameter.name: sort
inputParameter.description: A comma-separated list of fields to sort on. Prefix with "-" for descending order, otherwise in ascending order. Default: sort by matching scores in descending order.

inputParameter.name: facets
inputParameter.description: A set of comma-separated fields to return facets.

inputParameter.name: species_facet_filter
inputParameter.description: Used when faceting on species (i.e., facets=taxid are passed). It’s used to pass species filter without changing the scope of faceting, so that the returned facet counts won’t change. Either species name or taxonomy id can be used, just like species parameter.

inputParameter.name: entrez_only
inputParameter.description: Returns only the hits with valid NCBI Gene identifiers.

inputParameter.name: ensemblonly
inputParameter.description: Returns only the hits with valid Ensembl gene ids.

inputParameter.name: dotfield
inputParameter.description: control the format of the returned fields when passed "fields" parameter contains dot notation, e.g. "fields=refseq.rna". If "true" or "1", the returned data object contains a single "refseq.rna" field, otherwise ("false" or "0"), a single "refseq" field with a sub-field of "rna". Default: true.

inputParameter.name: email
inputParameter.description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you
